text: This page describes the qualification procedure for FIBA Women's EuroBasket 2021. 14 teams will join the co-hosts France and Spain. ==Qualifying draw== The draw for the qualification took place on 22 July 2019 in Munich, Germany. {| class="wikitable" |- !width=25%|Pot 1 !width=25%|Pot 2 !width=25%|Pot 3 !width=25%|Pot 4 |- style="vertical-align:top" | | | | |} ==Groups== The top team from each one of the nine groups, as well as the five best-finishing second-placed teams, will qualify. Due to the COVID-19 pandemic, each group will play the November window at a single venue. All times are local. ===Group A=== ===Group B=== ===Group C=== ===Group D=== ===Group E=== ===Group F=== ===Group G=== ===Group H=== ===Group I=== ===Ranking of second-placed teams=== The five best second-placed teams from the groups qualify for the final tournament. Matches against the fourth-placed team in each group are not included in this ranking. ==Qualified teams== {| class="wikitable sortable" |- ! scope="col" width="120" | Country !! scope="col" width="320" | Qualified as !! scope="col" width="110" | Date of qualification !! scope="col" width="50" | Last appearance !! scope="col" width="200" | Best placement in tournament !! scope="col" width="20"|WR |- | || Host nation || || align=center| 2019 || || align="center"| |- | || Host nation || || align=center| 2019 || || align="center"| |} ==References== ==External links== *Official website Category:EuroBasket Women qualification Category:EuroBasket Women 2021 Category:2019–20 in European women's basketball Category:2020–21 in European women's basketball
title: EuroBasket Women 2021 qualification
